snippet: To learn more about a TV show you’re watching, you can turn to so-called second-screen apps on your smartphone or tablet. But it’s still unclear how many viewers will want to use them.
abstract: Randall Stross Digital Domain column notes study by Nielsen Co that found 40 percent of smartphone and tablet owners in the United States self-report that they use their devices daily while watching television to check e-mail and surf the Web; observes so-called second-screen apps on devices provide information about programs being watched, but it is unclear how many viewers use them.
lead_paragraph: To learn more about a TV show you’re watching, you can turn to so-called second-screen apps on your smartphone or tablet. But it’s still unclear how many viewers will want to use them.

headline.seo: Apps Let You Supplement the TV Show You’re Watching
headline.main: The Second Screen, Trying to Complement the First
